title: PRD: Paper Search
description:
## Type
Documentation

## Required Reading
- docs/VISION.md (search stage description, success criteria)
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md (pipeline interface pattern)
- .claude/rules/prd-format.md

## Files to Create
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd006-search.yaml

## Required Sections (per prd-format rule)
- id: prd006-search
- title: Paper Search
- problem: Researcher must manually find papers outside the pipeline
- goals: G1-G4 (query interface, source backends, result ranking, output format)
- requirements: R1 (Query interface), R2 (Source backends: arXiv API, Semantic Scholar API), R3 (Result ranking and deduplication), R4 (Output format: list of identifiers + metadata for acquisition), R5 (Rate limiting and access)
- non_goals: Full-text indexing, citation graph traversal, crawling, building a paper database
- acceptance_criteria: Checkable outcomes

## Content Hints
- Problem: Pipeline starts with search per VISION.md but no PRD defines the search interface. Researcher currently must find papers manually and provide URLs/DOIs.
- Goals: Single query interface across multiple academic sources; ranked results with metadata; direct feed into acquisition stage
- Requirements:
  - R1: Query accepts free-text research question or structured query (author, title, keywords)
  - R2: Backends: arXiv API, Semantic Scholar API; extensible to others
  - R3: Results deduplicated across sources, ranked by relevance
  - R4: Output is a list of candidate papers with identifier, title, authors, abstract, source
  - R5: Rate limiting per source API; configurable delays
- Non-goals: We do not crawl or mirror; we do not build a local paper index; we do not traverse citation graphs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All required sections present per prd-format
- [ ] Requirements numbered and specific
- [ ] File saved at docs/specs/product-requirements/prd006-search.yaml

title: Implement container runtime detection (docker/podman fallback)
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-conversion.yaml (updated R5 with container runtime requirements)
- scripts/markitdown-converter.sh (existing pattern: podman run --rm -i markitdown:latest < input > output)
- .claude/rules/go-style.md (Strategy pattern, no magic strings, error handling)

## Files to Create
- internal/container/runtime.go (create) - ContainerRuntime interface, DetectRuntime, docker/podman implementations
- internal/container/runtime_test.go (create) - tests for detection, image check, and run

## Requirements
- Define ContainerRuntime interface with methods: Available() bool, ImageExists(image string) error, Run(image string, stdin io.Reader, stdout io.Writer) error
- Implement DockerRuntime and PodmanRuntime structs satisfying the interface
- DetectRuntime() function that tries docker first (checks 'docker info'), falls back to podman ('podman info'), returns error if neither available
- ImageExists checks via 'docker image inspect <image>' or 'podman image exists <image>'
- Run executes 'docker/podman run --rm -i <image>' piping stdin/stdout
- Binary names as constants (binDocker, binPodman)
- Wrap all errors with context per go-style

## Design Decisions
- Strategy pattern: ContainerRuntime interface with two implementations
- DetectRuntime returns the first available runtime, not both
- Run accepts io.Reader/io.Writer for stdin/stdout to match the markitdown pipe pattern
- Use exec.LookPath for initial binary detection before calling 'info'

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] DetectRuntime returns docker when docker is available
- [ ] DetectRuntime returns podman when docker is unavailable but podman is available
- [ ] DetectRuntime returns descriptive error when neither is available
- [ ] ImageExists returns nil when image exists, error when it does not
- [ ] Run pipes stdin to container and captures stdout
- [ ] All binary names are constants
- [ ] Tests cover all three detection scenarios (docker, podman fallback, neither)

description:

## Requirements
- Accept free-text research questions (R1.1)
- Accept structured query parameters: author, title keywords, abstract keywords, date range (R1.2)
- Query arXiv API (export.arxiv.org) (R2.1)
- Query Semantic Scholar Academic Graph API (R2.2)
- Each backend independently configurable (R2.3)
- Continue with remaining backends when one fails (R2.5)
- Deduplicate across backends by DOI, arXiv ID, or title similarity (R3.1)
- Merge metadata from duplicate sources preferring more complete fields (R3.2)
- Rank by relevance with optional recency bias (R3.3, R3.4)
- Output human-readable table to stdout (R4.2)
- Support --json flag for programmatic output (R4.3)
- Each result includes preferred acquisition identifier (R4.4)
- Rate limiting: arXiv 1 req/3s, Semantic Scholar 100 req/5min (R5.2, R5.3)
- User-Agent header and configurable timeout (R5.4, R5.6)

## Design Decisions
- Strategy pattern: SearchBackend interface with ArxivBackend and SemanticScholarBackend
- Fan-out queries to all enabled backends concurrently (goroutines with WaitGroup)
- Deduplication uses normalized title comparison when identifiers do not match
- Backend interface extensible for future sources

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] research-engine search returns results for a free-text query against arXiv
- [ ] research-engine search returns results for a free-text query against Semantic Scholar
- [ ] Combined results are deduplicated and ranked
- [ ] JSON output flag produces valid JSON
